* The invention also provides a nucleic acid encoding the streptavidin mutein, a vector containing the nucleic acid, and a cell transformed with the vector.
* The streptavidin muteins can be produced using a process involving transforming a suitable host cell with a vector containing the nucleic acid, culturing the host cell under conditions that allow expression of the mutein, and isolating the polypeptide.

• The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, specifically for photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources such as 248 nm (KrF) and 193 nm (ArF).
• The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at these wavelengths and are prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, poly(styrene-acrylate) resin, or novolac resin with diazonaphthoquinone halide in the presence of an amine. The invention also provides anti-reflective coating compositions containing these polymers and methods for their preparation and use.

* The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
* The nickel catalysts are preferably derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
* The guanylating agents used are thioureas and isothioureas, with preferred protecting groups being Boc, Cbz, and arylsulfonyl groups.
* The methods involve reacting the guanylating agent with an amine or pyrrolidine in the presence of the nickel catalyst.
* The reactions are preferably carried out at room temperature in a solvent system such as DMF, THF, DMSO, or water mixed with any of the foregoing.
* The percent yield of the reaction is at least about 10% after a reaction time of about 30 minutes for thioureas and about 2 hours for isothioureas.
* The nickel catalyst acts as a catalyst during the guanylation reactions and can be recovered and reused.

* The invention describes a process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, which are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in said plant cells for producing a non-replicating recombination product containing said DNA sequence of interest.
* The at least two different vectors are also adapted for integrating said DNA sequence of interest into said chromosome, and said DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of said at least two different vectors, said sequence portions being necessary for expressing said function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process also involves selecting plants or plant cells expressing said function of interest.
* The invention provides transgenic plants or parts thereof produced by the process of the invention, as well as libraries of plants, plant cells, or plant seeds obtained or obtainable according to the process of the invention.

* The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10 to 350 μm.
* The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties.
* The film can be produced cost-effectively and passes fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and the UL 94 test.
* The film has high UV resistance, thermoformability, and does not embrittle on exposure to heat.
* The film can be used for outdoor applications and critical indoor applications, and can be recycled without difficulty.
* The invention also relates to the use of this film and a process for its production.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, with a focus on reducing end breakage rate.
* The process involves twice health-preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, carding, drawing into strips, and spinning into yarn.
* The health-preserving step is conducted under specific temperature, humidity, and duration conditions to improve the flexibility and spinnability of bast fibres.
</summary>

• The invention provides a method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 142b (1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane) using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The organic feed is 142b and the fluorinating agent is HF (hydrofluoric acid).
• The process is carried out at a molar ratio of HF:142b in excess of 1:1, preferably in excess of 2.5:1, and more preferably in excess of 5:1.
• The catalyst used is CrF3.4H2O (chromium fluoride hydrate) or Cr/Ni/AlF3 (chromium/nickel/aluminum fluoride).
• The process can be carried out in a continuous, plug flow adiabatic reactor.

• The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers laid at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric, held together by stitching or other external means.
• The improvement involves the use of rake mechanisms synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, to achieve greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns and allow successive courses to overlie a portion of an already laid course so as to better control the strength and thickness of the resulting layer, with the overlying portions being parallel to the first courses.

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types.
• The method involves sequentially taking small partial quantities from different fiber lots, such as fiber bales.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener for removing fibers, a quantity measuring device, and a control device.
• The control device determines the partial quantity to be removed based on the momentary entire quantity of the fiber bale and controls the bale opener accordingly.
• The partial quantity is removed only from the measured fiber lot in a continuous manner.
• The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
• The partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than by the end of a predetermined period.
• The control device includes a computer and a control apparatus, and it controls the displacement of the transporting device on which the bale opener is mounted.

• The invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom, specifically to inserting different weft threads with appropriate weft carrying forces.
• Prior looms use uniform air pressure for all weft threads, leading to varying insertion speeds and wasted air pressure for thinner threads.
• The invention aims to provide stable weft insertion at the same speed for different threads and prevent undue air pressure consumption.
• This is achieved by ejecting air from main nozzles and/or subnozzles at different pressures or for different intervals, suited to the selected weft thread.
• Different weft carrying forces can be produced by varying subnozzle pitches, orifice diameters, distances from the warp shed, angles, or air supply intervals.

• The invention relates to an improved process for deacylation and desulfurization of a compound with the formula: ##STR3##
• Hypophosphorous acid is used in the process to improve product yield and reduce unwanted impurities.
• Pyrazolotriazoles are useful magenta couplers in photographic products but are difficult to synthesize.
• The desulfurization of triazolothiadiazines to pyrazolotriazoles involves a ring contraction reaction and hydrolysis/desulfurization with hydrochloric acid.
• The hydrolysis/desulfurization reaction generates elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, which are detrimental to subsequent reactions and photographic systems.
• The improved process uses hypophosphorous acid to reduce the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of H2S by-product, which can be readily removed from the reaction zone.
• The process improves the yield of the desired product and its purity.
• The invention provides two preferred embodiments for the process, using either hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid in the reaction mixture with hypophosphorous acid.

• The dry cleaning machine has a separate intake fan and duct for bringing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, which is exclusive of the air recirculating system and reduces exhausting residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The machine includes a refrigeration system with a single compressor for alternatively cooling two distinct evaporator coils under either a continuously timed demand or a cyclical temperature responsive demand, with the time demand having precedent.

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board, supporting an electric iron's cord and holding items like spray starch cans or beverage containers.
* The apparatus clamps onto the ironing board using a 'C' shaped clamp with an adjustable screw for securing it.
* The electrical cord support is a flexible mast with a helical bent portion at the top to receive the cord, a coiled spring resilient section, and a foot that pivots and slides within a brace on the clamp.
* The article holder is detachable, with tangs that fit into openings in a brace on the clamp, and can hold various items such as cans or bottles.
</summary>

* The invention is a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly useful for creating nonwoven webs.
* It combines aspects of eductive, non-eductive, and meltblown processes to improve web formation control, hygiene, and energy efficiency.
* The process involves spinning filaments into a quench chamber, drawing them through a slot opening using the same quench fluid, and collecting them on a moving mesh wire belt conveyor to form a non-woven web.

• The sewing machine 1 is provided with three receivers 94, 95, and 96 to detect an ultrasonic wave transmitted from an ultrasonic pen 92.
• The CPU 61 of the sewing machine 1 calculates the specified coordinates E (Xe, Ye, Ze) based on the detection timings T 2 of the receivers 94, 95, and 96 using Formulas (13), (14), and (15).
• The CPU 61 identifies the position specified using the ultrasonic pen 92 as the specified position based on the calculated specified coordinates E.
• The CPU 61 controls sewing based on the identified specified position.

• The invention is a frame quilting machine with two separate computers: one for controlling the sewing machine functions and another for controlling the quilting table movement.
• The machine allows for easy reprogramming of either the sewing machine functions or the table movement functions independently, without affecting the other.

* The invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, particularly for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, and moisture management.
* The preparations comprise a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder (preferably of macrofibril size or below) as a carrier for functional additives, and a binding agent.
* The functional additives can include anti-UV agents (like zinc oxide or titanium oxide), anti-bacterial agents (like nano-silver, zinc oxide, or titanium oxide), and bamboo powder for improved moisture management.
* The preparations are applied to the cellulosic fabric materials using methods such as printing, padding, or foam application, and the treated fabrics demonstrate enhanced functional durability even after multiple washing cycles.

* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip.
* The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop, allowing for continuous operation and the sewing of relatively stiff strips of material.

• The invention is a buttonhole controlling device for sewing machines that ensures buttonhole stitching closes without overlap, regardless of the type of material being sewn.
• The device includes a foot pad attached to a presser bar and a travelling assembly that moves with the work during sewing, consisting of a slidable member positionable by a button and a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine.
• An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point.
• The device is designed to work with machines that sew buttonholes in two halves: top bar stitches and left leg zig-zag stitches, followed by bottom bar stitches and right leg zig-zag stitches.
• The travelling assembly has an initial position relative to the foot pad defined by oppositely acting springs, and can be adjusted to compensate for different materials' slippage.
• The adjustable stop allows the operator to fine-tune the buttonhole length by adjusting the screw to retract or advance it relative to the tripping lever, ensuring perfect buttonholes are sewn.

* The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in nip presses, which exerts pressing forces on webs for forming paper, textile material, plastic foil, and other related materials. The sensing roll is designed to measure and remove the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile.
* The sensing roll comprises strategically-placed sensors, including a first set of sensors disposed in a particular configuration along a roll cover that overlies a cylindrical member. Each sensor of this first set is located at a particular lateral position (cross-directional position) on the roll cover. The sensing roll further includes additional sets of sensors which are likewise disposed in a particular configuration on the roll cover, each sensor of the plural sets of sensors being disposed at a particular cross-directional position. Each sensor is configured to sense and measure pressure when the sensor enters the nip region of the nip press. The plurality of readings can be used to calculate and formulate the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile for the press.

* The application is a continuation of an earlier abandoned application.
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor with an endless sieve belt, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The liquid applicator applies the liquid to the web at a first station, and the suction device removes the liquid at a second station downstream of the first station. The dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop between the applicator and the suction device.
* The apparatus is designed to lengthen the action time of the applied liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric or textile web, improve the washing effect, and maintain a small level of tension in the textile web, making it suitable for materials such as knitted fabrics and printed materials.

• The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
• The bobbin housing has a triangular shoulder with front and rear side faces, located on the loop cast-off side.
• A spring rod extends between front and rear cams, hindering the bobbin housing from co-rotating with the hook body.
• A capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the hook rotation, creating a gap for unhindered thread movement.
• The needle thread loop moves unhindered around the bobbin housing, through gaps, and is pulled back through the stitch hole.
• The invention provides a low friction motion of the needle thread loop, with or without the capsule release device.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabrics in various garments.
* The traditional method involves sewing the ends of the rope-shaped knit fabric, which increases thickness and reduces comfort.
* Sewing is done in a separate process from knitting, impairing productivity and increasing manufacturing cost.
* The manual sewing process can be irregular, lowering the product value.
* The invention provides a connective knitting method that joins two tape-shaped knit pieces during the knitting process.
* The method uses a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, at least one of which is movable.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted on different ranges of the needle beds with a boundary between them.
* The final course loops of both knit pieces are overlaid and bound off gradually, connecting the two pieces.
* The process is repeated until the two pieces are fully connected.
* The method allows for seamless joining of the knit fabrics, improving comfort, productivity, and product value.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making nonwoven fabrics with a three-dimensional image on both sides.
* The method involves hydroentangling a layered precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix, a second fibrous matrix, and a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim acting as a fiber distribution control layer.
* The precursor web is hydroentangled on a moveable imaging surface having a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The first and second fibrous matrices can be dissimilar, with the first side comprising a first fibrous matrix and the second side comprising a second fibrous matrix.
* The support layer deters excessive intermingling of the first and second fibrous matrices while providing sufficient resistance to delamination.
* The precursor webs can be pre-entangled on a foraminous-forming surface prior to three-dimensional imaging.
* The imaged nonwoven fabric can be subjected to post-entanglement treatments, such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, or application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions.
* Optionally, the imaged nonwoven fabric can be treated with a performance or aesthetic modifying composition to further alter the fabric structure or to meet end-use article requirements.
* The fabric can be used in various applications, such as home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and other end use products where a three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric can be employed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is about controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element.
* The braking element is coupled to a tensioning lever with a roller biased by the departing thread.
* The tensioning lever takes an angular position dependent on thread tension and net weight.
* Current creel arrangements automatically decrease braking force as spool wind diameter reduces.
* The invention aims to provide individual and global thread tension control for the entire creel.
* The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a spool holder and settable by fluid pressure.
* Each controller has a brake rotor, an adjustable braking element, and a tensioning lever with a roller biased by threads.
* A biasing arrangement activated by fluid pressure is connected to each tensioning lever.
* The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, altering thread tension.
* The biasing arrangement can be a piston/cylinder assembly, and preferably subtends an angle of 30° to 40° from the horizontal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a simplified process for continuously producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process involves partially coagulating and drawing the yarn, completing the coagulation, washing under specific conditions, and drying.
* The washing step reduces the amounts of total sulphur, sulphides, elemental sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead on the yarn to specific levels.
* The process produces a finished yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45, measured by the Hunter method using the Hunterlab apparatus.
* The wash water used has a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and is free from certain cations in amounts higher than specified.
* The process is preferably carried out with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during dynamic events, such as earthquakes, in braced frame structures.
• The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation, forming plastic hinges that absorb energy and limit loads transmitted to other parts of the structure.
• The device can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation, allowing for quick repair and reuse.
• The device can be adapted to various braced frame configurations and can be used both internally and externally on structures.

<summary>
* The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
* The BTR composite is designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process and topology optimization.
* The composite consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be curved or flat and have varying radii of curvature.
* The stuffer members and tendon elements can be embedded in a matrix material, and the tendon elements can be tied or bonded at their crossing points to form joints.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material, and a method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material.
• The traction element comprises at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength, with the core strand of each stranded cable being sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
• The production line comprises a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for the precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, at least one extruder for co-extrusion of the stranded cables in a flexible plastics material jacket, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
• The method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material involves degreasing and/or pretreating the stranded cables to improve the adhesion of the plastics material jacket, preheating the stranded cables to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material sheathing the core strands, and sheathed in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.
• The production line and method ensure increased flexibility in a traction element with a plurality of stranded cables and improved adhesion over the long term between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket, and more precisely and reliably control the spacing of the stranded cables guaranteeing tensile strength from the band surfaces even at increased production speed, delivering band-shaped traction elements of the best commercially available quality.

• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector for detecting the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
• The detector aims to overcome the disadvantages of conventional apparatus, such as the influence of static noise and vibration, and the difficulty and expense of machining curved reflecting portions.
• The detector includes flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs mounted coaxially to a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft.
• The first light shielding disc detects the sewing machine speed and a needle UP position, while the second disc detects a needle DOWN position.
• The third light shielding disc detects a thread trimmer timing position.
• The optical fiber supporter includes two optical fiber supporter pieces with linear optical fiber fixing holes for locking the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers.
• The optical fiber supporter is fastened to the enclosure of the detecting section such that the light shielding areas of the light shielding discs are disposed between the first and second reflecting portions.
• Light transmitted from the light sending optical fibers is reflected by the first reflecting portions, passes through the light shielding discs, is reflected by the second reflecting portions, and enters the light receiving optical fibers.
• The detector also includes a power indicating window for receiving one end of the power indicating optical fiber.

• The invention provides methods for producing silicon-based nanowires and films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
• The inks can be four-component or five-component, with the addition of a solid phase in the five-component inks.
• The liquid silane in the inks can be cyclosilanes such as Si6H12 or Si5H10, or linear or branched silanes.
• The inks can also include an accelerant to increase setting or curing times.
• The methods involve expelling the ink through a nozzle or film and exposing it to a high electric field to form continuous fibers.
• The fibers can be transformed into silicon-containing materials by thermal treatment or light activation.
• The silicon-based materials can be used as components in composite materials such as electrode composites.
• The invention also provides methods for producing electrically-conducting silicon-composite electrode materials using four-component or five-component inks.
• The methods involve combining a liquid silane, a polymer, a solid phase (for five-component inks), an accelerant, and a solvent to form a viscous solution, expelling the solution into the presence of a high electric field to form continuous fibers, transforming the fibers into a material containing a polysilane, an amorphous silicon, and/or a crystalline silicon fraction, forming a coherent, conductive coating on the external porosity of the silicon-containing fraction, and binding the material with one or more binders.

• The invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use in flophouses, workmen's quarters, or stadiums.
• The cabinet is a box-shape hexahedron consisting of four side surfaces, an upper surface, and a lower surface.
• It has a dual construction comprising an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them for forming boxes for electric devices or shelves.
• The outer casing has flat external surfaces, allowing for close stacking or adjacent installation of multiple cabinets.
• The clearance between the outer and inner casings can also house wirings for interior electric devices and provide natural ventilation and sound-proofing.

* The invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in construction sites to prevent falls and meet safety guidelines.
* The guard rail support consists of a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. It can be assembled and disassembled efficiently and can be used with wooden guard rails, mesh fences, or other safety barriers.

* The document describes a plow blade with a water passageway, designed to reduce friction and power requirements during underground utility installation.
* The blade consists of multiple components that can be assembled to create flow paths for fluid ejection at controlled locations and rates, allowing for customization based on job requirements.

• The document describes a patent application for a system to deaerate oxygen-bleached pulp before washing.
• The system aims to address the problem of reduced vacuum and foam formation in washers due to entrained oxygen.
• Previous proposals for deaeration include the Deculator process and large degassing chambers, but these involve expensive equipment.
• The invention is a small deaeration tank with no moving parts, designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor and supported by it.
• The tank has a tangential swirl-inducing inlet pipe for optimal deaeration, with the swirl-inducing fluid being filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
• The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a filtrate swirler inlet, with specific locations and sizes for optimal deaeration.
• The tank is designed to operate at atmospheric pressure or under low pressure or vacuum, and can be closed to allow steam or oxygen recovery.
• The system includes a thick stock pump, steam mixer, oxygen mixer, tower, pressure control valve, emergency bypass line, pulp washer, filtrate tank, and pumps for filtrate and counterflow.
• The deaeration tank has specific dimensions and component locations based on the tank's diameter (D), with a nominal slurry height of 0.8D and a typical diameter of 106.68 cm (42") for a 50-ton per day installation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe with a door structure that is easy to assemble and low-cost.
* The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a rectangular opening and a door that fits within it.
* The door is secured by a lock assembly on the reverse side, with reinforcing bolts to prevent force transmission to the lock mechanism.
* The safe can be embedded in concrete or made entirely of metal.
</summary>

* The invention relates to monitoring and measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, specifically to techniques that measure pressures at a desired elevation without being influenced by pressures above or below the measurement point.
* The invention describes methods and apparatus for installing a pressure sensing system in a borehole, including clearing the system of any bubbles or blockages, grouting the borehole, and creating a fluid connection between the formation and the pressure sensor by displacing the grout around the sensor inlet.

• The document is a source for a patent application that is a continuation-in-part of a previous application.
• It describes Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures that use soil reinforcing elements to reinforce an earth mass in combination with a facing element.
• A typical soil reinforcing element is illustrated, which includes a welded wire grid with longitudinal and transverse wires.
• The document discusses the need for a system and method to splice a soil reinforcing element to extend its length.
• The disclosure provides a splice for a soil reinforcing element, which includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to receive and seat transverse wires, and a connective device to couple the wave plates and prevent removal of the longitudinal wires.
• The disclosure also provides a composite soil reinforcing element that includes a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and the splice to couple them together.

* The lock device prevents a work machine of a construction machine from tilting by its weight.
* It comprises an engaging member and an engaged member, with the engaging member having a hook part and a slot, and being supported by a support pin and a guide member.
* The guide member is designed to keep the engaging member at a prescribed position and prevent it from slipping off.
* The lock device is intended for use in a work vehicle such as a tractor loader backhoe.

* The invention is a building system that allows for the creation of panels greater than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without movement control joints.
* The system uses a plaster matrix that embeds a mesh more outwardly of a batten fixed mesh.
* The plaster matrix is applied in multiple layers, with the first layer encapsulating the inner mesh and additional reinforcement at corners and around joinery.
* The second layer contains further reinforcement in the form of fibreglass mesh.
* The final layer is a sponge or plastic float finish.
* The system is designed to resist wind face loading up to and including those associated with VH wind speed zones.
* The weight of the total system is 41 kg/m2 and does not contribute to the building lateral bracing.
* The system may be fixed to wet timber framing provided the interior lining and insulation is not installed until the framing moisture content is less than 18%.

• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with an adjustable platform to regulate suction efficiency.
• The device has a flexible platform with a central, vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom.
• The adjustment is made using mechanisms located on the top of the suction head, allowing for quick and easy regulation of suction without adjusting the vacuum at the circulation pump.
• The device can be retrofitted with an adjustment kit to existing pool cleaning devices with minimal changes required.
• The adjustment kit includes frames, connectors, wing nuts, coil springs, and axles that can be assembled to the existing device to provide precise regulation of the suction head's spacing from the pool bottom.

• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function, useful for new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
• The jointing structure comprises steps at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
• The elastic members are mainly composed of laminated rubber, which is hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
• The joint block is made of the same concrete as the traveling path to provide increased slip resistance to tires and is highly durable.
• The elastic members and the joint block are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like, facilitating the maintenance of the joints.

* The invention is a pulsed power device and method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) using electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) methods.
* The device generates high-power pulses by rapidly releasing stored electrical energy from capacitors.
* The pulses can be used in a direct plasma mode through a spark gap or in an EM mode by discharging energy through a single- or multiple-turn coil.
* The device can be used in a single-level configuration or in a multi-level configuration with time-sequential and variable inductance discharges.
* The device can be used in a single well or in multiple wells to act as a source array.
* The device can be used in an injector well for water injection, surfactant injection, diluent injection, or CO2 injection.
* The device can be configured to operate in a rubber sleeve to isolate it from injected fluids or to be deployed in a packer assembly suspended by production tubing.
* The device can be oriented in any predetermined direction in azimuth and elevation using a directional energy cone.
* The device can be used in conjunction with additional materials such as steam, water, a surfactant, a diluent, or CO2 to increase the mobility of hydrocarbons and/or increase the flow of hydrocarbons.
* The device can be used to recover a wide range of hydrocarbons, including crude oil, condensate, and natural gas, as well as associated gases, helium, carbon dioxide, sulfur dioxide, pyrite, paraffins, and heavy metals such as chromium, manganese, and vanadium.

• The invention relates to track transport systems, specifically floor track systems used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks.
• The primary objective is to prevent contamination of the treatment fluid by the wheels or support structure of the hand trucks.
• The invention provides an enclosed floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber to move wheeled trucks in and out without contaminating the chamber's sanitary environment.
• One embodiment includes a wheel channel supported above the fluid level by legs, with a cover plate overlying the channel to prevent fluid entry.
• The cover plate can be pivoted away from the wheel channel for cleaning.
• Another embodiment uses inflatable elastomer seals along the top edges of the wheel channel sidewalls to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent fluid entry.
• The inflatable seals also act as a brake to prevent movement of the hand trucks along the track system when inflated.
• The enclosed track system prevents corrosion of hand truck wheel bearings and deterioration of rubber wheels.
• It allows for the recirculation and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontamination.
• The invention fulfills the need for an enclosed floor track system in fluid treatment chambers.

<summary>
* The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools that allow passage for other tools when not in use.
* Previous tools had limitations such as no central passageway for wireline access, complex designs, and limited power delivery.
* The new tool addresses these issues with an annular dump valve that keeps the center clear for wireline access.
* The tool can be easily switched between wireline mode and vibratory mode by dropping a removable plug.
* The dump valve opens and closes without being slammed against a seat, reducing wear.
* The mandrel is powered by stacked pistons in the tool body, magnifying power delivery.
* The tool can be configured to operate with or without impacts, depending on user preference.
* The modular design allows for customization based on specific job requirements.
* The tool can be used for various applications, including stimulation and fishing operations.
* The tool may also include a rotational lock for torque transmission.
</summary>

* The invention pertains to precast concrete retaining walls, typically used alongside highways and railways.
* The retaining wall system aims to reduce the pressure at the toe of the wall by providing a lever arm perpendicular to and behind the wall face, creating a moment opposite to the moment due to the horizontal force of the backfill material on the wall face.
* The wall consists of two discrete, modular parts: a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece.
* The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar of one module into an opening in the other module and then sealing the connection with grout.
* The invention also includes optional features such as H-piles for added stability, and a vehicle impact barrier formed and cast-in-place on top of or behind the wall.

<summary>
* The invention relates to systems and methods for improving oil and gas well production by delivering heat at or near the downhole end of production tubing.
* Existing downhole heaters have shortcomings such as improper heat focus and inadequate protection for electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
* The invention addresses these issues by focusing heat on the production zone and protecting electrical connections using a cement block and steel fitting assembly.
* The system includes production tubing, a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, stainless steel tubing collars, and a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods.
* The method for using the system involves installing the heating unit with shielded electrical connections and heat-retaining elements to focus heat on the producing formation.
* The method can also be used with cable instead of downhole pipe for supporting the heating unit during well treatments or maintenance.
</summary>

• The document discusses improvements to composed stave floors or engineering floors.
• Current floors have thin sight substrates (2-3 mm) that can deform or detach when sanded.
• The base substrate can suffer deformations and changes in dimensions due to glue use.
• The lifespan of current floors is short with no possibility of corrective maintenance.
• The method for manufacturing improved floors involves using a thicker sight substrate (at least 4 mm) and base substrate (at least 12 mm).
• Multidirectional holding means are used to bond the substrates, including dendrites, glue, and clamps.
• The improved floors have a longer lifespan and can undergo corrective maintenance.
• The floors can be pre-varnished with materials like aluminum oxide for better resistance.
• The numerical values in the document are approximations and can vary.
• The example embodiment provides a floor that does not deform or detach and can be maintained.

• The invention relates to ladder attachments for positioning the ladder away from the work surface, preventing damage to the work surface, and preventing slipping or sliding.
• Ladders often lack stability when used against a work surface, causing them to slide and potentially damage the surface.
• Typical ladders have a small contact area with the work surface, which can lead to defacement.
• Corners present a challenge for ladder stability, as ladders cannot straddle them without losing stability.
• The invention provides a brace for a ladder with an extension arm, a U-bolt for securing the brace to the ladder rung, and a resilient pad assembly that pivots to improve stability and allow corner straddling.
• The brace aims to increase the contact area with the work surface, improve lateral stability, and prevent damage to the work surface.

• The invention relates to downhole tools for mechanical activities in wells, specifically a simply and efficiently operable mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells.
• The tool can take the form of an external overshot or an internal spear, and is adapted to be provided on a wire line controlled pulling tool.
• The tool structure consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore.
• The tubular outer body is secured about the inner body by means of a catch mechanism having a locking position and an unlocking position, depending upon the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures. A pin structure forming a part of the catch mechanism is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves, and a control spring ensures that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.

<summary>
* The invention relates to oil well drilling tools and apparatuses, specifically an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from around the interior of the well head and casing.
* Wear bushings protect against excessive wear, particularly in seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements.
* The apparatus consists of a sub-unit with a mandrel having a longitudinal bore, an upper collar section for engagement onto a section of pipe, and a threadably removable lower collar section for engaging the end of a second lower section of drill pipe.
* A retriever section is inserted onto the mandrel, slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit, and adapted with protruding members around its exterior for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
* The mandrel section of the sub-unit has grooved sections running substantially its length, allowing the retriever unit to move along the vertical body but disallowing rotational movement.
* The retriever unit is removably securable on the exterior surface of the sub-unit, allowing it to be mounted on a string of drill pipe independently of threading on the pipe.
* The retriever apparatus allows vertical movement of the retrieving unit yet allows rotational movement of the retriever unit during operation.
* The retriever unit can be mounted onto a mandrel and connected onto drill pipe, allowing vertical play or movement of the retriever unit to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
* The wear bushing retriever apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.
* An additional embodiment of the retriever apparatus provides for retrieving the bushing by threadably engaging the bushing.
</summary>

• The invention relates to position and motion sensors, specifically for mechanical systems like diesel engine fuel injectors.
• The sensor reduces wiring by outputting changes in current proportional to the position of the object, using only two wires.
• Multiplexing is employed to connect multiple sensors to the same set of wires, reducing the number of wires required.
• The sensor eliminates strong static signals and error signals that waste energy, using a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit.
• The sensor constantly compares its output to a desired minimum value, adjusting in different directions based on the speed of the object being monitored.
• The sensor generates a small reference signal to eliminate small values of drift and a large reference signal for rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage.

* The present invention pertains to collated fasteners, specifically a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* The nail strip is configured with a plastic collation system that reduces debris generation as the nail is driven into the substrate.
* The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, such as a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, that adheres to the nails and penetrates the substrate with the nail.
* The collation system includes an upper and lower plastic molding adhered to the nails, with the upper molding formed nearer to the head of the nail and the lower molding formed nearer to the tip of the nail.
* The connecting portion between the nails can include a bridge and a rib, with the rib having a concave shape as it extends between the nails.
* The collation system is configured to influence separation of the nails from one another at a desired location, such as at the juncture of the connecting portion and the collar portion of a subsequent nail, to further reduce debris generation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants like silicones in multiple artifacts or machines.
* It is useful in diverse industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle comprises a bell or hood lower section coupled to an injection button.
* The button has a particular design with channels and orifices for precision sealing operations.
* The bell-shaped tip facilitates encapsulation of rivets or screws, particularly in the aeronautical industry.
* The button allows guiding the injection of the sealant around the rivets and nuts.
* The nozzle can be used both manually and by automated sealant injection machines.
* It is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene.
* The sealant application is performed after drilling orifices in the parts to be joined.
* The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, ensuring the pressurization and lifetime of aircrafts, ships, trains, or automobiles.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, specifically for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston.
• The system aims to reduce gas consumption by efficiently controlling valve port openness in concert with vehicle operation.
• It provides simple, precise, and timely valve control, enhancing engine performance and smooth operation.
• The system enables piston firing sequences and individual operations to be designed and controlled.
• It eliminates the need for springs in valve functioning, simplifying the system and reducing power consumption.
• The system is amenable to higher engine speed performance, enhancing engine performance and gasoline savings.
• It provides a simple, robust construction that is precisely controlled at all times.
• The invention is applicable to various engine configurations, including multiple valves per cylinder.

* The invention relates to a system for controlling a fuel delivery device, allowing for both automatic and manual control of a throttle valve.
* The system includes a control unit that processes signals from an accelerator pedal and throttle valve position to automatically set the throttle position for optimal vehicle performance.
* The control unit also manages a clutch that connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve for manual control, ensuring a smooth transition between automatic and manual modes.

* The invention is an evaporative cooler that separates the dry and wet sides of a heat exchanger to cool air without adding water vapor, using recirculated air from the enclosure to be cooled as the working air.
* The system can be enhanced by flowing moisture-laden return air in heat exchange with fresh air, or by using a hybrid system that combines evaporative cooling with a minor portion of vapor compression refrigeration to dehumidify the air and further reduce the dry bulb temperature.

<summary>
* The light member includes a housing with a top side facing away from an interior of the aquarium and a bottom side facing the interior.
* The bottom side includes a lighting control region with a first control channel for white light, a second control channel for blue light, and a neutral channel disposed between them.
* The light member includes a switch coupled to the housing to control the first control channel and a dimmer switch to control the second control channel.
* Light-emitting modules can be releasably coupled to the lighting control region and are electrically connected to one or more of the channels to emit white or blue light.
* The modules include electrical connectors that couple to the channels and springs that bias the connectors into contact with the channels to assure a good electrical connection.
* The modules can include narrow incident angle LEDs, wide angle LEDs, optical elements, and/or heat sinks.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to archery equipment, specifically apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
* The invention aims to solve problems associated with prior art methods, such as stress exerted on the shaft due to internal threads and dirt entering the shaft through unsealed ends.
* The invention provides a point cap system with an adjustable balance pin, a point adaptor for broadheads, and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to arrow shafts.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series.
* Each pump head comprises a housing containing an impeller driven by a drive structure.
* The housing of the pump head comprises an inlet and at least two fluid conduits.
* The fluid pump comprises a combiner for combining fluid flow from the at least two fluid conduits into a single fluid flow.
* The drive structure passes through the inlet between the first and second pump heads and commonly drives the first and second impellers.
* The fluid pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together.
* A pump assembly comprises a fluid pump mounted on a support structure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, specifically a cooled stator blade or rotor blade for a gas turbine.
* Present-day flow deflection apparatuses use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperature to required levels.
* The known cast separating walls and deflection devices have disadvantages such as difficult-to-cool transitional regions, thermal stresses, high blade weight, and complex casting.
* The invention aims to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that is simple to produce, flexibly matchable to the respective application, and efficiently cooled.
* The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured there.
* The use of inserts has advantages such as no large amount of material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, reduced blade weight, simpler cast core, easy adjustment of the cooling system, and secure seating for the inserts.
* A preferred embodiment of the flow deflection apparatus is a blade in a gas turbine, with cooling channels and separating walls extending essentially in the radial direction with respect to the rotation axis of the gas turbine.
* Another embodiment, particularly advantageous for rotor blades that rotate at high speed, has the integral material joint arranged at the end of the separating walls close to the axis.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves engine performance and reduces intake noise.
• The device comprises a tank with two pipes connecting it to the intake passage, one with a larger cross-sectional area and one with a smaller cross-sectional area.
• A valve is disposed in the larger pipe and is controlled by an actuator responsive to engine operating conditions.
• The smaller pipe acts as a resonator to absorb noise, while the larger pipe and valve influence the dynamic effect on engine performance.

• The invention is a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment to various surfaces, including poles, flat surfaces, and walls.
• The system allows for easy, one-person installation and adjustment, and is resistant to weather, wind, and vibration. It consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that snap together temporarily and are secured with screws. For pole mounting, it includes a pole clamp assembly with adapter brackets and a chain.

• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training, specifically for the M16 rifle.
• It uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic charges, ignited by an electrical ignition system.
• The simulator produces sound and flash by igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
• The simulator is packaged to resemble a magazine clip, with an upper end designed for insertion into the M16 and a lower end housing the electrical control circuitry and the plastic expendable.
• The pyrotechnic charges are ignited by heating a bridge wire to incandescence, producing combustion by-products that simulate small arms fire when vented.

• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste.
• Conventional wood waste burners are inefficient and produce undesirable pollution, requiring large furnace chambers and frequent cleaning.
• The invention aims to provide a clean-burning waste fuel burner that meets local environmental regulations and produces minimal slag or clinkers.
• The burner operates effectively on wet wood with up to 70% moisture content and is self-regulating with fast response times.
• The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile for drying and gasification.
• Volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially in a primary combustion chamber.
• The primary chamber maintains a temperature lower than the ash melting point, and the swirl air forces particulate out of the gas stream.
• A flame holder in the primary chamber throat prevents particulate from entering the secondary chamber, where complete combustion occurs with secondary air introduced tangentially.
• The burner can be coupled to any source of dirty, particulate-laden combustible gas for burning and removing particulate to meet environmental emission standards.
• The control system adjusts air and wood feed rates based on BTU demand, with trims for swirl and secondary air based on temperature or oxygen levels.

* The present disclosure relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner that can be part of a system including interchangeable heat utilizing appliances.
* The burner is designed to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions when using solid fuels such as firewood and charcoal briquettes.
* The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.
* The burner also has a shroud providing a second wall surrounding the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns.
* The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber above ground level, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover to close the combustion chamber and prevent the ingress of dropped items and exposure to heat and exhaust fumes.

• The present invention relates to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure like an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes need to withstand various loads, including extreme ones like blade-off events.
• Conventional gearboxes and connections are rigid to withstand all anticipated loads, often requiring additional material or weight.
• The invention describes a link assembly with a male link, a female link, and a pin that allows translation of the male link relative to the female link and dampens translation via a radial interface.
• The female link receives the male link, allowing translation and forming a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The pin is releasably coupled to the male and female links to selectively retain them.
• A gearbox assembly includes the link assembly to couple the engine to the gearbox.
• The technical function of the embodiments includes the dampening of translation and selective retention of the links.
• The female link and male link are in contact at a radial interface, providing coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation.
• The snap ring limits the relative travel of the male link within the female link, preventing separation after the pin is sheared.

• The invention relates to minimizing flow disturbances caused by closing and reopening turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• It uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through parallel inlet flow control valves.
• This maintains constant steam generator pressure and minimizes turbine power changes during inlet control valve testing.
• The method determines flow as a function of control valve position and compensates for flow changes due to valve closure.
• The invention has been successfully tested, reducing pressure excursions by 95% compared to a system without flow compensation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
* The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure while simultaneously performing work in an expansion turbine.
* The arrangement includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and an electronic control system that operates the compressors and valves.
* The invention aims to reduce investment and operation risks by eliminating the need for conventional re-cooling plants and their associated safety issues.
</summary>

• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.
• Traditional engine compression release brake systems typically include an engine brake for each engine cylinder.
• A reduction in engine components can improve the overall robustness of an engine.
• The invention provides an engine with an engine compression release brake for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, wherein the portion is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders.
• A method of engine braking using less than all engine cylinders includes attaching an engine compression release brake to an engine housing for a portion of the engine cylinders and operating the portion of engine cylinders in a braking mode.
• The engine includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, and an engine compression release brake for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, wherein the portion is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders, and each engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• The engine compression release brake includes a pilot valve member and a spool valve member that control the flow of high pressure fluid to a piston that opens an exhaust valve for engine braking.
• The engine compression release brake is modular and can be used with any number of engine cylinders and can provide any desired amount of braking horsepower.
• The engine compression release brake can be positioned above or below a rocker arm and can open an exhaust valve by contacting an exhaust valve actuator or lifting a rocker arm.

<summary>
* The document discusses the challenges in cooling rotary internal combustion engines, particularly the area around spark plugs.
* In-line spark plugs create flow disruptions and vapor films, preventing efficient heat extraction.
* Spark plug bosses in rotary engines are affected by more heat than those in reciprocating engines.
* The document aims to improve cooling and reduce thermal distortion by optimizing spark plug boss arrangement.
* The invention proposes staggering spark plug bosses in the cooling flow passageway to improve coolant performance.
* The staggered arrangement reduces the flow shadow effect and improves coolant velocity distribution around the bosses.
* The preferred embodiment shows two spark plugs offset symmetrically about the centerplane of the flow, with flow diverters between the bosses.
* Tests showed that the staggered configuration increases the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line arrangement.
</summary>

<summary>
* Electronic components generate heat, requiring cooling to prevent overheating and failure.
* Free convection cooling may not be sufficient, necessitating the use of cooling fans.
* Cooling fans are often mounted to enclosures using fasteners like screws, which increase cost and labor.
* The disclosed system eliminates fasteners by using a snap-fit mechanism for mounting cooling fans to enclosures.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor carrier with mounting legs that snap into recesses on the panel.
* The installation process involves compressing and rotating the fan assembly until the mounting legs snap into place.
* The system uses spring members to urge the motor carrier away from the panel, preventing vibrational noise and dislodging.
</summary>

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials, which lack inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise instrument functionality.
* Existing kinematic mounts have limited success in protecting instruments from flight loads due to their lack of damping and provisions to minimize transmitted loads.
* The invention introduces kinematic mounts with passive energy dissipating mechanisms to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
* The mounts use damping materials at flexure locations to dissipate vibration energy, with designs that preserve fundamental features and achieve significant damping improvements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large size oil shear type clutch unit for aircraft catapult systems, with interleaved clutch plates and discs that are alternately clamped together or separated in an axial direction.
* The clutch unit has separate piston and cylinder means for each clutch disc segment, minimizing residual drag and allowing for maximum torque transmission.
* The clutch discs are segmented, allowing for easy removal and replacement of individual segments without disassembling the entire mechanism.
* The clutch unit uses hydraulic fluid for both retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, with applications in aircraft cleaning apparatuses.
• The valve has two inlets (A and B) and one outlet, allowing for a mixture ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
• Pressurized cleaning apparatuses using a mixture of water and a concentrate (like soap or wax) are common, and the invention aims to provide a stand-alone cleaning apparatus with adjustable cleaning solution strength.
• The valve system comprises a valve body with a first inlet passage for receiving a first fluid at a first predetermined pressure, a second inlet passage for receiving a second fluid at a second predetermined pressure, an outlet passage, and a valve means disposed within the body for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range, in an analog fashion, between a proportion of about 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to about 100% first fluid, 0% second fluid.
• The valve system includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of the first fluid and maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.
• The valve means comprises a spool valve with two perpendicularly intersecting bores, allowing for continuous adjustment of the fluid mixture proportions.

* The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering is sensed in image-producing fashion.
* The method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.

* The text describes a system and method for obtaining and using global satellite positioning (GPS) data to facilitate providing service in a telecommunications network.
* The system includes a technician input device, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system. The method involves requesting GPS coordinates for a customer service location, obtaining those coordinates using the GPS system, and updating relevant databases with the coordinates. The system can also generate driving directions between customer service locations using the GPS data.

• The application is a continuation of a previous U.S. application and claims the benefit of three provisional applications.
• The invention relates to internal combustion engines with multiple cylinders, where exhaust gas is delivered to a second cylinder for further expansion, and water is injected into the cylinders to create steam and drive a piston.
• The engine aims to reduce the temperature of the exhaust gas and water to such an extent that a radiator can be eliminated, and to recover water from the system for reuse.

• The invention aims to reduce specimen vial mislabeling in medical facilities.
• It involves using barcodes on patient ID bands, orders, specimen-taker badges, and specimen vials.
• A computer stores and relates these barcode numbers in a database data structure.
• The system verifies that the patient and order barcodes match before proceeding.
• It tracks specimen collection time and compares it to a predetermined time interval.
• The lab receives all order and label information linked to the vial barcode number.
• The system ensures a complete record of the specimen collection event is stored in the database.

• The document describes a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, using GPS technology and voice recognition software.
• The device is designed to be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and provides distance and other information to the user via spoken words.
• It uses commercially available GPS data to convert longitude and latitude coordinates to measure distance and other factors.
• The device incorporates a bone conductance vibration sensor to pick up the user's voice clearly while rejecting external noise.
• It also includes Bluetooth technology for data transfers, audio server/client functions, short-range audio communications, and remote GPS.
• The device allows users to record geographic coordinates of a golf course and its features using a portable computing device with a GPS.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element and several guide structures, with the ring element being composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined and connected, preferably welded, in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are joined across an engagement zone and welded along edge regions facing each other therein.
* The flat material ring segments are connected via positively engaging joint contours forming an undercut geometry.
* The joint contours are configured to provide adequate coupling with as short a weld seam length as possible.
* The joint contours are preferably configured such that the weld seams taper towards the ring element inner and outer edges with an obtuse angle.
* The flat material ring segments are cut out, preferably punched out, from a sheet metal material.
* The flat material ring segments are formed as 120° ring segments, requiring only three weld points for joining.
* The rolling body guide cage can be structured to be composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry.
* The method for manufacturing the rolling body guide cage involves joining at least two flat material ring segments in succession in the circumferential direction before forming the ring element.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably welded to one another in the region of a joint formed by these flat material ring segments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to accelerating the execution of floating point operations in data processing systems.
* The focus is on improving the effective subtraction operation, which is more complex and time-consuming than addition due to the need for aligning fractions and normalizing results.
* The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents of the two operands (ABS{DELTA(E)}).
* When ABS{DELTA(E)} is less than or equal to 1, the alignment of fractions and subtraction can be performed simultaneously, reducing the number of steps.
* When ABS{DELTA(E)} is greater than 1, the subtraction operation can be performed to ensure a positive result, and the normalization and rounding can be combined into a single step.
* The invention also introduces a technique using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments (TDELTA(E)) to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.
* The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof) before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is available.
</summary>

• The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat treated to obtain parts having good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.
• The fabrication method described in patent EP 0971044 can be applied to butt-welded blanks, but this method runs into difficulties when welding coated steel blanks, as a portion of the initial surface pre-coating is transferred into the molten area created by the welding operation, leading to the formation of intermetallic areas that reduce the overall deformability of the welded joints after heat treatment.
• The present invention provides a solution to eliminate the source of these intermetallic areas by removing the metal alloy layer of the precoat in an area at the periphery of the plate, before welding.
• The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed must be adjusted to ensure that the precoat is not introduced into the molten metal during welding and to provide sufficient corrosion resistance of the welded assembly after subsequent alloying and austenizing heat treatment.
• The invention also provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate that includes coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat having an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, on at least one face of the plate, removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate and cutting the plate in a plane so that the area from which the metal alloy has been removed is at the periphery of the cut plate.

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources.
* It compares a first and second segmentation, or "regions of interest" (ROIs), recorded in electronic files.
* The segmentations are converted to volume models and compared to identify missing or extra volume elements.
* The missing and extra volume elements are measured and optionally weighted according to their distance from the reference volume elements.
* The invention may be used for quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
* The electronic computer generates a first and second volume model from the first and second electronic file, respectively.
* The volume models are compared to identify common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements.
* A measure of conformance between the three-dimensional surfaces circumscribing the structure defined by the first and second electronic files is output based on a metric method measuring numbers of missing volume elements and extra volume elements.
* The electronic computer may display a cross-sectional image through the first and second volume models along a user-defined cross-sectional plane separately identifying the common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements by different colors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to semiconductor design technology, specifically to systems and techniques for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs).
* A design rule check (DRC) is a process to inspect mask pattern data of a semiconductor IC to ensure it complies with fabricators' topological layout rules (TLR).
* The invention aims to accurately report appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
* It eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
* The method checks whether a logic part of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules and the memory part obeys memory rules, which are modified logic rules to accommodate more liberal values available for memory regions.
* Customized rules are created for different types of memory regions by modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory-based parameters onto stricter logic-based parameters.
* The invention helps filter out false errors due to logic rule checks in a memory block and helps pinpoint real design rule errors in the mask pattern data.
</summary>

* The invention provides a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
* The test apparatus comprises a test head with exciting means to magnetize the rotor, voltage sensing means to generate a voltage signal responsive to the rotor's magnetic flux variations, current sensing means to sense the alternating current used for magnetization, and processing means to determine the rotor's resistance and reactance.
* The apparatus may also include skew sensing means to sense the effective electrical skew of the rotor and generate an effective skew signal.
* The processing means determines the effective electrical skew of the rotor responsive to the effective skew signal.

• **Government Support**: The invention was made with Government support under contract F300606-88-D-0025 awarded by Rome Air Development Center, Department of the Air Force.
• **Parent Application**: This application is a continuation-in-part of U.S. Patent application Ser. No. 07/790,516 filed Nov. 12, 1991.
• **Field of Invention**: The invention pertains to using waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
• **Background**: Thin substrate waveguides, characterized by t>>λ and t<w, can be used for controlled illumination, avoiding difficulties in coupling the optical source and allowing for convenient white light illumination.
• **Summary of Invention**: Thin substrate waveguides can be used to provide improved, controlled illumination of objects, including holograms and spatial light modulators, with extremely high diffraction efficiencies.
• **Non-uniformity Compensation**: Non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam without compensation or by recording the hologram non-uniformly.

<summary>
* The present invention is a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile energy recovery system.
* The system is designed to optimize efficiency in energy recovery by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, and relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure.
* The mobile structure can be a sailing or propelled vessel or barge, or any mobile buoyant energy recovery system known by one of ordinary skill in the art.
* The algorithm optimizes efficiency in energy recovery by adjusting points of sail, rudder rotation, openness of turbine gates, and ballast draft, through control outputs from the microprocessor system on-board the sailing vessel.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data through diverse means such as Global Position Satellite (GPS) systems, weather satellite systems, and various geographic and weather data resources.
