* The SCADA computer servers run Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software applications which communicate to microprocessor systems running client software with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to allow remote humans to optionally interact and choose mission critical navigation plans.
* The mobile structure comprises a control and communications microprocessor system along with the central service facility further comprising a microprocessor system running secure server software applications and workstations running secure client software applications communicating with the server via a Local Area, Network (LAN).
* The control and communications microprocessor system located within the mobile structure comprises a type of microprocessor computing system known as a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC).
* The preferred embodiment employs a more cost-effective wireless communications system communicating between the mobile structure and the central service facility upon which this present specification will subsequently expound.
</summary>

* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip protected by two shock-absorbing layers and encased between two rigid outer layers.
* The card is made by pre-shrinking a core layer, printing indicia, applying alkyd resin spids and antenna, attaching IC chips, bonding the core layer to a bottom sheet with an adhesive layer, and laminating two polymer layers to the core layer.
* The card can have image-receiving layers for dye diffusion thermal transfer printing or inkjet printing, and a protective layer to prevent dye bleeding and provide security features.

* The invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, particularly embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies.
* The invention provides methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, including using DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors for EPROM memory cells and utilizing transistor properties changed under stress conditions to support EPROM operations.

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit.
* The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors into three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable kind of averaging.
* The averaging is described by a matrix multiplication, where V is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the virtual sensor, M is the 6×6 matrix describing the averaging, and S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors.
* The output signals of the virtual sensor are used as inputs for independent control loops operating in parallel, which transform the virtual input signals V into modified signals {circumflex over (V)} using a control algorithm described by an operator Ω.
* The matrix {circumflex over (V)} is multiplied by a 6×6 matrix L to obtain control signals for the six coils.
* The algorithm used by the control system is described as O=L·Ω(M·S).
* If the interference field is inhomogeneous, a single actuator coil instead of a pair of Helmholtz coils is used, and M is a 3×6 matrix, and L is a 6×3 matrix.
* If two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, a 6×6 feedback, or crosscoupling matrix C is used to avoid interferences.
* The matrix S of the output signals of the real sensors is enlarged to a 6×1 matrix Ŝ to account for the feedback, and the control signals are calculated as O=L·Ω(M·(S−C·O)).
* The invention allows for compensating homogeneous as well as inhomogeneous magnetic fields, performing a simulation of measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected, and equalizing potentially arising feedback effects in the case of using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity.
</summary>

* The text describes a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library.
* The method also involves denying access to native resources of the operating system to a managed application, where the managed application includes a digital certificate authorizing it to access a specific native resource of the operating system through the managed library.
* The method can be implemented using a manager effectuated by native instructions, which can be configured to grant or deny access to native resources based on information that identifies managed libraries that the managed application is authorized to access.
* The method can also involve authorizing a request from the managed application to access a native system resource through the managed library, where the manager includes information that identifies managed libraries that the managed application is authorized to access.
* The method can further involve authorizing a request to access a native system resource by the managed library, where information that identifies that the managed library is authorized to access the native system resource was obtained from a digital certificate associated with the managed library.

• The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control systems.
• The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain value, executing feedback control using this value, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating these steps with different gain values.
• The optimum feedback gain value is then calculated based on the relation between the gain values and the corresponding evaluation values.
• The method is particularly suited for determining the proportional gain, integral gain, and differential gain in PID control systems.
• The evaluation value for the proportional gain is the ratio between the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against time and the length of the time axis.
• The evaluation value for the integral gain is obtained by integrating the error, and the evaluation value for the differential gain is obtained by integrating the absolute value of the error.
• The method can be applied to various feedback control systems, including those used in automatic guidance vehicles.

• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes a stationary ring and a movable ring within a test enclosure.
• A splined hub, upon which the driven disc assembly is mounted, is disposed between the rings.
• A torque motor rotates the hub, and a servo motor moves the movable ring.
• An electronic position sensor measures the distance between the rings.
• An optical encoder measures the rotation of the hub.
• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator.
• It generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
• The apparatus measures the warpage of the driven disc assembly and compares it with a standard value to determine if it is excessively warped.

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure.
* The tree is balanced, meaning all leaf nodes are at the same level and all internal nodes are full, except for nodes on the edges.
* Nodes have a maximum size, and the tree is maintained by adding data units to the first non-full node on the first edge and deleting data units from a leaf node on the opposite edge.
* The path from the root to the point of updating is copied from the structure, and the update is made in the copy.
* The time and space required for each update are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
* A header node can be added to the structure, comprising three elements pointing to the end, middle, and beginning of the queue.
* Additions are made to the node constituting the end, and only then to the tree-shaped structure.
* Deletions are made from the tree-shaped structure, and the deleted leaf node is made to be the node constituting the beginning of the queue.
* The queue can be inverted in constant time and constant space by changing the value of an inversion bit in the header node.
* The queue can be used as a double-ended queue, allowing additions to the beginning and deletions from the end.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a motor vehicle's security system, particularly an access and/or ignition control system.
• The transmitter has a housing containing electronics and a communication means that can communicate with a similar means on the vehicle.
• A payment element is removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, and a closure is separately arranged on the housing.
• The identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and a secure state. In both states, communication with the security system is possible.
• In the secure state, the payment element is removed from the receptacle, and the closure protects and seals it.

• The invention relates to face age-estimation methods, systems, and software.
• Face age-estimation is challenging due to variations in human faces and aging mechanisms.
• The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract unique features from images.
• CAM combines shape variation and texture variation to represent aging faces.
• The invention uses support vector regression (SVR) to construct aging functions for youths and adults.
• An age classifier is built using support vector machines (SVMs) to distinguish between youths and adults.
• The invention uses a growth and development mapping function for youths and an adult aging mapping function for adults.
• The estimated age is provided as a single age or age indicator with an optional confidence factor.
• The invention can be implemented using a computing system with a processor, memory, and software embodying the methods of the present disclosure.

• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the image with higher definition.
• The device comprises a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.
• In each arrangement, a first plurality of pixels is dedicated to displaying a first image and receives light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the first image that correspond thereto.
• One or more other pixels of the arrangement are dedicated to displaying a second image and receive light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the second image that correspond thereto.
• The matrix display device produces the merged display of the first image and the second image, which may be redimensioned by scaling means if necessary.
• The controller can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the first image to enhance the contrast of the merged image.

• The invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus capable of controlling with high precision the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads, with a particular focus on magneto resistive (MR) heads.
• The apparatus includes a control signal generator for generating control signals for controlling the operating amperages of MR heads, a decoder circuit for discriminating data of the control signals, and a current supply circuit for supplying operating currents to the MR heads in response to the output signals of the decoder circuit.
• The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer and set the operating currents of the MR heads. The control signals may also include control information regarding a regenerative amplifier for reproduced outputs of the MR heads and recording current setting for recording heads.

* The invention provides a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that can be quickly and easily installed or removed using simple tools and available fasteners.
* The device consists of two parts: an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it, and a cover plate member that is latched onto the attachment member without visible fasteners. The cover plate member can be easily removed using a small tool inserted into a slot in its bottom end wall.

* The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, such as television sets and monitors, consisting of concentrically nested annular strips that can slide over one another between a pushed-in and pushed-out position.
* The strips have decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing the device to be positioned at various angles relative to the screen, and are provided with hook or locking elements for reliable folding and unfolding. An adapter member is also provided for flat attachment to monitors with curved fronts.

<summary>
* The invention aims to improve the locating and tracing of one concealed object (like a pipe or cable) in the presence of an adjacent object.
* It uses a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the adjacent objects.
* A receiver, movable relative to the transmitter and objects, senses the magnetic fields associated with these currents and produces an output signal dependent on both fields.
* The currents can be distinguished by using different carrier frequencies, modulation frequencies, or pulse rates.
* The transmitter's position is optimized for better performance, and the receiver's sensitivity can be adjusted.
* The invention is particularly useful when the horizontal separation between the objects is less than half their depth.
</summary>

• The document describes an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The apparatus includes a selector switch for choosing between regular operation and automatic answering mode, a coupler for connecting the telephone network to the speaker phone, a timer for limiting the duration of the call, and an extend switch for bypassing the timer.
• The apparatus can be used with a private telephone line or switchboard extension and is designed to be portable and easily connectable.
• The document provides two embodiments of the interfacer, one electronic and one electromechanical.
• The apparatus is intended to be safe, reliable, low in cost, and high in convenience.

• An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, enters a "sleep mode" when inactive to save energy.
• The toner used in such devices is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, and a toner concentration (TC) sensor measures the concentration of toner in the developer.
• If the imaging device is inactive for a long period, the tribo charge of the toner may decrease, affecting image quality.
• The exemplary embodiments address these issues by determining periods of inactivity and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
• One method involves measuring the toner charge level when the printing machine is recovered from inactivity and charging the toner based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level.
• An apparatus for charging a developer in an imaging device includes an inactivity determining section and a charging section.
• The inactivity determining section determines one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device, while the charging section charges the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
• The above-described method and/or apparatus may be included in a xerographic machine.
• The disclosed methods can be implemented in software or hardware, and variations or improvements may be made by those skilled in the art.

<summary>
* The invention provides a method and device for detecting elementary particles that enables both the measurement of individual particles and the integration of count rates as a function of signal rates without knowing in advance the count or signal rates to be expected.
* The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through it, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and indicating or recording the signal after amplification.
* The device includes a detector for generating a charge pulse when a particle passes through it, at least one amplification device for converting the charge pulse into an electric signal and amplifying it, and optionally a display and/or recording device.
* The method and device enable the detection of signals or pulses generated by elementary particles irrespectively of a previous restriction required in the prior art in respect to a possible detection of individual particles or an integration of the same.
* Discharging of a charge pulse or signal from the detector is performed on the low-voltage side to avoid excessive noise and enable a simpler distinction of small-size signals relative to a base quantity.
* Individual signals are amplified in a first, fast amplifier and signals are integrated in a second, slow amplifier at least upon exceeding a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
* The signals are separated as a function of the rate by a capacitor preceding at least a first amplifier for amplifying individual low-rate signals, or a high-pass element, and/or by an inductive element preceding at least a second amplifier for amplifying high-rate signals, or a low-pass element.
* The method and device can be used for detecting particles in particle accelerators, in reactor installations, in diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices, CT devices or the like.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a zoom lens with a large relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end, while maintaining a reduced size and high optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
• The zoom lens comprises, from front to rear, a first lens unit of positive power for focusing, a second lens unit of negative power for varying the magnification, a third lens unit of negative power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth lens unit with a positive lens for making the diverging light beam from the third lens unit an almost parallel light beam, and a fifth lens unit with an image forming function and having lenses of positive, negative, positive, negative, positive, and positive powers in this order.
• The following conditions are satisfied for the focal length of the j-th lens in the i-th lens unit, the radius of curvature of the j-th lens surface in the i-th lens unit, the Abbe number of the glass of the j-th lens in the i-th lens unit, and the focal length of the i-th lens unit:
	+ 0.7 < |R.sub.4,2 /F.sub.4 | < 0.85
	+ 1.05 < |f.sub.5,2 /F.sub.5 | < 1.5
	+ 0.6 < |f.sub.5,4 /f.sub.5,5 | < 1.5
	+ 50 < (ν.sub.5,1 + ν.sub.5,6)/2 < 59
• The total length of the entire lens system is reduced to as short as L=9.13φ A to 9.19φ A.

<summary>
* The invention relates to automated speech technologies, specifically helping listeners understand speakers better.
* It automatically informs a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it likely exceeds a rate that a listener can understand.
* The speaking rate threshold can be based on the listener's estimated or known listening rate, which can vary based on their proficiency with the language being spoken.
* The speaker can be notified through various sensory mechanisms, such as vibrations, beeps, or displayed messages, on a wearable computing device.
* The invention can also suggest shifting to an alternative language that both the speaker and listener are proficient in, if appropriate.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes using a TV camera, with means to deviate and suppress the beam for scanning lines on a picture plane.
* The device includes a cyclic line counter that supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses, controlling beam suppression and vertical deviation.
* The line counter is preferably programmable, allowing for selectable time and spatial resolution.
* The device can record processes at higher picture sequence frequencies than conventional TV cameras, with the option to fill gaps between lines in subsequent scans for digital analysis.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to optical fiber communications, specifically to system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification within such networks.
* The focus is shifting from expanding point-to-point capacity to developing more reliable undersea lightwave systems with multipoint-to-multipoint connectivity.
* A ring topology and trunk and branch structures enhance network survivability.
* The invention aims to reduce the number of undersea optical repeaters by replacing them with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy over the same branch cables.
* The system consists of an optical fiber cable trunk in ring topology with hubs and branching units serially coupled along it.
* The branch fiber optic cables transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength to power optical amplifiers, providing signal amplification without conventional optical repeaters.
* The invention offers advantages such as maintaining full connectivity in case of a cable cut, isolating only the associated cable station in case of a branch cut, respecting sovereignty concerns, and allowing for reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.
• Existing data synchronization methods lack support for arbitrary attributes, geographical distribution, priority ordering, bundling of related data sets, and efficient handling of connection disruptions.
• The present framework provides a central reference point that accepts context from connected client devices, constructs responses in a compatible semantic, prioritizes download order, downloads files, and rejects incompletely downloaded bundles.
• The framework supports multiple languages, character sets, and appliance operating systems, and employs data compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize bandwidth usage.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure instead of a wafer saw.
* The method involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to singulate the individual die.
* The apparatus includes a pad for supporting the wafer, a positioning member, and a pressure mechanism.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system and method for facilitating communication between a finder of a lost object and its owner.
* Owners register unique IDs associated with their objects and their contact information with the system.
* Finders access the system using the ID found on a tagged object and can send anonymous messages to the owner.
* The system generates anonymous email addresses for both the finder and the owner for each communication.
* The system also supports instant messaging and text messaging for communication between finders and owners.
* The system ensures the privacy and security of both the finder and the owner by never displaying real email addresses or other contact information.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions in a packet domain.
• A blended call is a call that combines voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session.
• The invention uses a multimedia server with blender software to manage blended calls, handling voice components through a telephony server and multimedia components through the multimedia server.
• For incoming calls, the telephony server checks if the recipient supports blended capabilities. If yes, the call is directed to the multimedia server's blender software, which initiates parallel voice and multimedia components.
• For outgoing calls, the telephony server or multimedia server checks if the caller supports blended capabilities. If yes, the blender software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components.
• The blender software controls the signaling paths of the parallel components, allowing the multimedia server to control the bearer paths for multimedia requests.
• The invention is compatible with various network systems and protocols, with an exemplary embodiment based on a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) environment.

* The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal.
* The invention aims to provide a much longer bulb life by combating mechanisms of bulb degradation and further protect users from burns.

• The invention is an electron multiplier using thin foils in an evacuated enclosure.
• It was made with government support and has certain rights.
• It relates to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors.
• Two types of conventional electron multipliers are discrete dynode and continuous dynode.
• The foil electron multiplier is a next generation design with higher gain and simpler fabrication.
• It uses a series of thin, in-line foils to create secondary electrons and allow incident particles to continue to the next foil.
• Advantages include higher gain, simpler fabrication, lower cost, larger area coverage, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.
• The foil electron multiplier uses sequential stages of thin foils to multiply electrons in transmission.
• The gain is maximized by optimizing electron transmission, grid transmission, and secondary electron emission yield.
• The invention does not experience ion feedback, unlike continuous electron multipliers.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements.
* The protection structure includes one or more reduction plates or electrodes on the cathode.
* A bias voltage source applies a negative voltage to the reduction plates, attracting positive nitrogen and oxygen ions and preventing them from contacting the cathode.
* The reduction plates can be elongated and parallel to rows of field emission elements or arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration.
* The reduction plates are fabricated on the cathode using photolithography and etching techniques.
* The invention prolongs the lifetime of field emission elements by preventing current-induced burnout damage.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an antenna array for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation, specifically the elevation angle of signals.
• The array consists of at least four antennae spaced to form at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet characterized by its element spacing and center height.
• The array uses radio interferometric techniques to obtain information signals from each antenna, processes these signals to derive a quotient signal for each triplet that is a function of elevation angle but not of ground reflection coefficient, and selects at least one quotient signal to provide a measure of the elevation angle.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes.
* Typical CCD image sensors are flat and image on one surface.
* The invention allows imaging through edges of the sensor.
* The image sensor has a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and edges.
* One edge has a surface receptive to light for imaging.
* An image sensor element is located adjacent the light-receptive edge.
* The element includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region.
* Charge carriers generated by light impinging on the edge surface are guided toward the charge collection and transfer means.
* The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, including through edges.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to power management in home networks with devices that have network administrative functions.
* A network master node performs these functions and can enter a power management mode when not performing its nominal device functions.
* The master node can transfer the network administrative functions to a slave node before entering power management mode.
* The master node sends data enabling the network administrative functions to the slave node.
* The slave node accepts the transfer and becomes the new master node.
* The master node can select a slave node based on visibility, intelligence, functional capabilities, or user selection.
* The slave node can self-promote to the master node role if the transfer fails.
</summary>

* The electroluminescent display panel can display different colors by changing the driving voltage, without using an intermediate electrode.
* The panel can selectively display in a color including no visible red components or in a color including visible red components with a high luminance.

• The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention allows viewers to watch 2D motion pictures with a 3D effect using the Pulfrich illusion.
• It consists of viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses and a Glass Lens Controller Unit (GLCU) that processes the motion picture and controls the lenses.
• The GLCU has a digital sensor to capture images, a processor to identify synchronization events, and means to control the darkness of the lenses.
• The lenses can take three states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear.
• The GLCU uses an intensity edge algorithm to detect lateral motion in the motion picture and control the lenses accordingly.
• If no lateral motion is detected, both lenses are set to clear.
• If lateral motion is detected moving from left to right, the left lens is set to clear and the right lens to dark.
• If lateral motion is detected moving from right to left, the left lens is set to dark and the right lens to clear.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope works with any motion picture media and viewing device, and does not require any special equipment or alterations to the motion picture.

• The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, a system for Internet telephony, and a method for Internet/network telephony.
• The terminal comprises audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means for near field communication with a connecting unit adapted to establish a connection to a network and/or the Internet according to a standardized Internet/network protocol.

* The invention relates to a method for inserting advertising clips into a video sequence at points of high discontinuity and low attractiveness, such as shot changes.
* The method selects the most suitable clip by comparing the salience maps of the video sequence and the advertising clips, ensuring a continuity of regions of interest between them.

* The invention aims to eliminate unwanted signal actuation of non-linear components in receiver input circuits, causing distortions, while maintaining adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components.
* The solution involves using three amplification control loops: the first and second loops protect the mixer stage and varactor diodes from overloading, while the third loop, with a lower response threshold and frequency bandwidth, supports the other control circuits or reduces the signal response threshold from a certain spurious signal level on.

• The source document is a continuation of a patent application, Ser. No. 13/447,415, which is a continuation of Ser. No. 12/401,711, now U.S. Pat. No. 8,175,189.
• The invention relates to multi-user (MU) MIMO wireless systems and describes a method for configuring a generalized decision feedback equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a base station.
• The method computes a filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas, and based on the computation of C, computes a transmit filter matrix B, a feedforward filter matrix F, and an interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• The invention provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE precoder and relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise."
• The invention achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE precoders and is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including planned future "4G" cellular networks.

• The invention relates to network-based shared workspace environments and a method for spontaneously setting up collaborative work-sharing between physically distant individuals.
• Current collaborative tools like video conferencing, document sharing, and shared whiteboards require complex setup processes.
• The invention aims to simplify this process by using a collaboration button and indicator on telephones to initiate collaborative sessions during an ongoing voice call.
• The system uses a call control unit with phone proxies to manage call states and collaborate indicator status.
• The collaboration control program on each PC communicates with the phone proxy to control the collaborate indicator and launch collaboration applications.
• The system can determine if parties to a call have common collaboration application programs and protocols, and illuminates the collaborate indicator if they do.
• The collaborate button, when pressed, launches a collaboration application on the user's desktop and may also launch it on the remote party's desktop.
• The system can accommodate multiparty collaboration and can be implemented in a peer-to-peer architecture or on top of dedicated telephone systems with data connections at the desktop.

• The invention relates to using a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections in very small dimension semiconductor devices, reducing electrical breakdown and leakage.
• The problem arises from facetted regions at intersections of conductive members with a planarized surface, which produce pointed locations with high electric field concentrations.
• The invention positions the mask member below the surface to be planarized, at a location where the surfaces of the regions separated by the dielectric are undisturbed and have complete integrity.
• The mask position is in the range of about 0.5 to 20 nanometers, with 5 nanometers being preferred, below the surface to be planarized.
• The invention is particularly useful in damascene type device structures, where adjacent conductors are disposed in thin trenches in an intralevel dielectric material, and masking is employed to protect the dielectric material between conductors during processing operations.
• The structure and process of the invention provide a lower and predictable overall capacitance, resulting in faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring.

<summary>
* The document discusses a continuation of a previous application.
* High-dielectric oxide materials, such as Pb/Bi-containing ones, have advantages like ferroelectric properties and size reduction of capacitors.
* Integration of non-SiO2 based oxides on Si is difficult due to Si's strong reactivity with oxygen.
* A SiO2 or silicate layer forms at the Si/oxide interface, degrading the usefulness of non-SiO2 based oxides with Si.
* High-dielectric constant oxides can't be deposited directly on Si due to the reaction forming a low dielectric constant layer.
* Putting high dielectric materials on a conductive layer hasn't solved the problem of Pb/Bi diffusion.
* A Ge buffer layer on Si can prevent or minimize the formation of the low dielectric constant layer.
* An epitaxial Ge layer on Si provides a good buffer layer compatible with Si and many oxides.
* The Ge buffer layer allows ferroelectrics to be directly grown on Si wafers for non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory cells.
* A thin layer of SrTiO3 or other stable ferroelectric can act as a buffer layer between Pb-containing ferroelectrics and the Ge-coated Si substrate.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, specifically an axial fan with improved intake airflow rate and heat-dissipating performance.
• A conventional fan has a rectangular housing with a cylindrical air passage, tapered portions at the corners, and screw holes for mounting.
• The conventional fan has limitations in air passage design, blade shape optimization, and intake airflow rate improvement.
• The invention aims to provide a heat-dissipating fan and housing that enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying existing assembling conditions.
• The housing has an outer frame with a passage for guiding air streams, and an sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake or discharge area.
• The sidewall of the passage can extend outwards symmetrically, beyond the outer frame, or in a frustum-conical or frustum-elliptically conical manner.
• The sidewall of the passage can be formed with an inclined portion or a beveled edge to further enlarge the intake area or reduce noise.
• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing, with the impeller's blade dimension increasing along with the radially outward extension of the housing's sidewall.
• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, electrical elements, and the heat-dissipating device, which can be an axial fan and assembled with a heat sink.
• The heat-dissipating device can be mounted to the system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN).
* The mobile terminal receives information about neighboring base stations from an access point in the WLAN, allowing it to skip some connection setup time when switching to the WWAN.
* The mobile terminal has a first network module (e.g., GSM) for connecting to the WWAN and a second network module (e.g., WiFi) for connecting to the WLAN and receiving the service information.
* The mobile terminal turns off the first network module and turns on the second network module when connecting to the WLAN, and vice versa when switching to the WWAN.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a Downconverting Digitizer that converts an analog modulated IF signal to a digital representation, downconverts it to baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components, and automatically controls the processed modulated IF signal amplitude to extend the dynamic range of the digitization process and minimize quantization noise.
* The digitizer consists of a digitally-controlled variable gain amplifier, gain control logic, analog summing element, sampler, predictive digital filter, offset nuller element, digital summing element, digital-to-analog converter (DAC), digital quadrature mixer, and rate reduction filters.
* The predictive loop generates a prediction of the input signal, and when the prediction is subtracted at the summer, a prediction error signal is generated. The predictive filter minimizes this error signal, and the output of the predictive filter is a digital representation of the analog modulated input signal.
* The offset nulling loop estimates and removes offsets introduced by implementation imperfections, and the AGC loop maintains the amplitude of the modulated carrier within the dynamic range of the predictive loop.
</summary>

• The source document describes a process for manufacturing multilayered electrical components, specifically capacitors, using a decal transfer method.
• The process involves printing electrodes and electrical components onto decals, curing them, and then stacking the decals to form a multilayered assembly.
• The assembly is then fired to fuse the electrodes together and form the final electrical component.
• The process aims to simplify manufacturing by eliminating steps such as cutting and metallizing, and to reduce labor costs.
• The process is also adaptable to other electronic ceramic devices, such as multilayer ferrite inductors and multilayer substrates.
• The process enables the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and a variety of shapes, and enhances in-process inspection.

* The process involves co-producing power and hydrocarbons using a combination of dry and wet gasification technologies.
* The integrated IGCC power plant and CTL plant share utilities such as an air separation unit and water treatment stage, reducing costs and improving energy efficiency.

<summary>
* The text describes an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, specifically for foam sheet stock used in manufacturing containers like coffee cups.
* The apparatus allows for precise, parallel cuts to be made on the foam sheet sample using a razor blade, preserving the cell structure for examination.
</summary>

* The invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically apparatus and method for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms or gas molecules.
* The sensors are used for label-free direct real-time detection of biomolecule binding and have the potential for very high-sensitivity detection.
* The sensors are fabricated using nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes.
* The nanotraces are used as a sensor or, when anchored probe molecules are covalently coupled or synthesized to the surfaces, as multiplex detection devices for simultaneous detection of many simultaneous detection zones.
* Binding of complementary targets to the anchored probe molecules in the vicinity of the semiconducting active layer produces a change in electrical conductivity of the semiconducting active layer that can be monitored externally for each sensor device in parallel.
* The method for fabricating the sensors involves using nanoimprint lithography to pattern a semiconducting active layer into a set of parallel nanotraces over the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes.
* The fabrication process also involves developing the electrical architecture for addressing each drain electrode and preparing the final device for microfluidic coupling.
* The sensors are used for multiplex detection of analytes by detecting changes in electrical characteristics of the nanoscale materials for each device.

• The invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device using an oxide superconducting material, focusing on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface.
• Conventionally, metal superconducting materials have been used, but they require liquid helium for cooling and have low practical utility.
• Oxide superconducting materials, while having higher practical utility, suffer from a deterioration of characteristics at the surface or portion close to the surface due to oxygen deficiency.
• The invention aims to provide a method for preparing a superconducting device that maintains superconductivity at the surface or portion close to the surface of the oxide superconducting material.
• This is achieved by forming a blocking film (passivation film) over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that surface.

* The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of lead surfaces.
* The method involves plating the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
* The leads are copper, and the plating material is a different material than the leads, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
* The leadframe has a top surface and a bottom surface opposite the top surface, and the step of singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies comprises performing a full cut of the leadframe in a single cutting operation before the step of plating the exposed side surfaces, wherein the full cut extends all the way between the top surface and the bottom surface.
* The semiconductor dies are attached to the bottom surface of the leadframe, and the method further comprises plating the top surface of the leadframe before the step of singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies.
* The leadframe has a top surface and a bottom surface opposite the top surface, and the step of singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies comprises performing a first partial cut of the leadframe, wherein the first partial cut does not extend all the way between the bottom surface and the top surface, and performing a second partial cut of the leadframe, wherein the second partial cut is performed separately from the first partial cut and completes the singulation of the semiconductor dies all the way between the bottom surface and the top surface of the leadframe, thereby forming a plurality of singulated semiconductor packages.

• The invention relates to seismometers, particularly those designed to operate on the ocean floor, and a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by such a unit during its operation and for leveling the seismic motion detectors carried by such a unit.
• The invention comprises a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination of a seismometer and for leveling its seismic motion detectors.
• The invention uses a pendulum arrangement with a spherical ball and a shaft protruding from it, with one or more seismic motion detectors mounted at the end of the shaft.
• The pendulum action of the invention automatically aligns the seismic motion detectors with respect to the vertical for proper operation.
• The invention includes a locking mechanism with a spring-loaded plunger and a pin that restrains the plunger from contacting the spherical ball.
• The pin is connected to a linearly acting solenoid, which when activated, removes the pin, allowing the plunger to extend and lock the spherical ball, shaft, and detector in their assumed positions.
• The invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed in a seismometer.
• The invention provides good acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the detector through a rigid connection from the detector to the seismometer frame.
• The invention allows for the determination of the angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer with respect to the vertical at the time the ball was clamped by measuring the acute angle formed by the ball, shaft, and detector in their locked position and a vertical surface.

• The present invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices.
• Sandwich panels are structural materials that may comprise a core enclosed between two sheets of material.
• Existing lattice structure geometries used in sandwich panel cores include tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, kagome, and honeycomb.
• Lattice structures utilizing trusses to form the core material of a sandwich panel are typically constructed from a lattice with a single unit cell size.
• The present invention provides a lattice structure utilizing a network of hierarchical trusses, synergistically arranged, to provide support and other functionalities.
• The design results in a generally hollow core, maintaining a low weight while providing high specific stiffness and strength.
• Sandwich panels are used in various applications, including sea, land, and air transportation, ballistics, blast and impact impulse mitigation, thermal transfer, multifunctional structures, armors, ballistics, load bearing, construction materials, and containers.
• An aspect of an embodiment comprises a structure with a first lattice structure and a second lattice structure, each comprising primary and ancillary arrays with cells of different orders.
• The ancillary array is nested with the first primary array, and the second primary array is mated with the first primary array to form a third lattice structure.
• The lattice structures can be used as the core of a sandwich panel or other structure, with face sheets attached by suitable means.
• The lattice structures can be manufactured using various methods, including injection molding, investment casting, and metal textile lay-up techniques.
• The lattice structures can be used in various applications, including structural materials, impact or blast energy absorption, catalyst support systems, and deposition of thin film batteries.
• The present invention is not limited in scope by the specific embodiment described herein, and various modifications, variations, alterations, substitutions, and equivalents will be apparent to those skilled in the art.

• The invention is a multiorifice wafer structure with angularly disposed passages for atomizing fuel in automotive fuel injectors.
• The structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods interspaced with cylindrical members, with each layer of rods disposed at a progressively larger angle.
• The fused assembly is then cut into thin wafers, creating angularly disposed passageways that increase in angle as a function of their distance from the center.

• The invention provides methods for manufacturing semiconductor devices with improved controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall, enabling the formation of an LDD structure by a low temperature process, and preventing degradation of transconductance and increases in resistances due to hot-carrier injection into the oxide portion on the gate sidewall.
• The methods involve forming an insulating film on the gate electrode, followed by forming a layer on the insulating film and anisotropically etching it away using RIE, leaving a portion thereof on the gate sidewall. The layer can be made of polycrystalline silicon, oxide, high melting point metal, or silicides.

• The document describes a method and system for generating a mobile time reference in a portable transceiver, using a high frequency oscillator (TCXO) and a low frequency oscillator (CO).
• The mobile time reference is maintained during idle mode using the low frequency clock and updated drift/bias estimates, allowing for quick transition to active mode and reducing power consumption.
• The system includes a free running counter (FRC) that generates the mobile time reference, a multipath monitor, and a multipath radio signal recovery circuit for detecting, identifying, and monitoring multipath signals in a WCDMA system.

• The invention describes a humidity sensing element that responds to changes in relative humidity by varying its impedance linearly and rapidly (within one second).
• The sensor consists of a first electrode (aluminum), a porous dielectric coating (anodized aluminum oxide), minute particles of conductive material (nickel) deposited in the dielectric's porosity, and a second electrode (porous nickel) on the opposite side of the dielectric, with an ion-forming material (aluminum monohydrate) contacting the particles and reducing the dielectric's porosity.
• The sensor is manufactured by anodizing the first electrode, depositing nickel particles in the anodized layer, sealing the anodized layer, and then depositing a porous nickel layer to form the second electrode.

• The invention relates to improving Internet Protocol (IP) telephony by integrating a wireless telephone with a computer.
• The wireless telephone has a speech coder and decoder, and can operate in both wireless and IP telephone modes.
• In IP telephone mode, the wireless telephone communicates with a computer, which performs network protocol conversion.
• The computer can be a low-end device since it doesn't need to perform speech coding and decoding.
• The wireless telephone provides a convenient handset and reduces echo problems.
• The system can be controlled from either the wireless telephone or the computer.

<summary>
* The invention is an improved individually fitted helmet liner.
* It consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with open, unfilled pockets.
* The pockets allow the sheets to deform and conform to the wearer's head.
* The liner is fitted by heating it to a plastic state, placing it on the wearer's head, and allowing it to cool.
* It can be refitted to accommodate changes in head size.
* The open pockets simplify manufacturing and improve comfort.
* The liner resists shifting on the wearer's head and does not require drawstrings or trimming.
</summary>

<summary>
* The document describes a motor assembly with an improved force transmission structure.
* The force transmission structure comprises a drive plate and a shaft.
* The drive plate has a Y-shaped mounting hole with three interconnected sections.
* The shaft has a Y-shaped toothed portion with three teeth fittingly received in the mounting hole.
* The drive plate is driven by a gear train connected to the motor.
* The gear train includes a worm, a worm gear, and a damper made of rubber.
* The drive plate has V-shaped protrusions that engage with the damper.
* The shaft is held captive within the mounting hole by a circlip.
* The improved force transmission structure reduces vibration and noise, and can withstand greater torque.
</summary>

* The invention provides a simplified connection system for high voltage cables up to 400 KV and above, using a common cable connection system for all accessories and interconnections.
* The system uses a cable termination and a rigid insulator with a conical interface surface, which can be an inner cone, outer cone, or a slight inner cone (or plane) concept.
* The invention offers advantages such as factory pretesting, reduction of installation time and cost, reduction of tools, simplified field testing, and no risk of gas or oil leaks or explosions.

• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter for lamp power supply that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at a predetermined value set by a potentiometer.
• The converter eliminates low frequency and high frequency flicker light in the output, reducing eye fatigue and protecting eyesight and health.
• The converter uses a Flyback topology with an integrated circuit controller for control, feedback realized with auxiliary winding, and a potentiometer for dimming and feedback circuit.

• The system controls electric lights based on four presets: Minimum, Medium Low, Medium High, and Maximum.
• The system controls window treatments to maintain a desired illumination profile and to minimize or eliminate sun glare.
• The system adjusts the control of window treatments based on the sun angle to reduce glare.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process and apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine of a cigarette-production and/or cigarette-packaging machine.
* The detection process involves using at least one optical checking element, such as a camera, to detect an image of a plurality of cigarettes located in the cigarette magazine.
* The image is evaluated by an image-processing device, which compares it to a reference image or reference values to detect any deviations.
* If a deviation is detected, an error signal is produced, which can trigger an ejecting unit to remove the defective or incorrectly positioned cigarette.
* The elimination process involves actuating an ejecting unit arranged in the region of the magazine to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to the ejecting unit.
* The ejecting unit has a front wall and a rear wall, with the rear wall being larger than the front wall to prevent jamming of cigarettes only partially gripped by the front wall.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers and the mounting of blades onto the central drive shaft.
* Blades are typically mounted using pins welded onto the drive shaft, with the blade sliding between the pins at an installation angle and then pivoting to a shallower angle.
* The invention aims to facilitate the mounting of blades while still using a pin type connection.
* The blade has a first L-shaped locking track on the inner side and a second L-shaped locking track on the outer side, both having an entry track and an intermediate track.
* The inner finger of the pin slides into the entry track of the inner side and the outer finger slides into the entry track of the outer side during installation.
* The intermediate track on the inner side extends only to the mounting hole, while the intermediate track on the outer side extends past the mounting hole to accommodate the outer finger.
* The blade can only be slid onto the pin with the inner side facing downward and the outer side facing upward, ensuring correct installation orientation.
* The blade is prevented from sliding off the pin in the downward direction due to interference between the pin and the blade on both sides, even at the installation angle.
</summary>

• **Vehicle Battery Rebalancing**: The process involves measuring cell voltages, identifying the cell with the minimum voltage, and bleeding down other cells until their voltages are approximately equal to the minimum. Continuous voltage measurements are taken during this process.
• **Power System with Battery Rebalancing/Charging**: The system includes a battery with multiple cells and a controller that causes the cells to acquire charge for a specific time period, ensuring that all cells have approximately equal voltages at the end of the period. The charge acquisition rate may differ among cells for at least a portion of the period.
• **Battery Pack Charge Time Calculation**: The time required to charge the battery pack depends on the cell requiring the greatest change in capacity, the charge current rate, and the method of balancing the cells to the same voltage. The time necessary to pass current around a selected cell is also a factor in determining the total charge time.

• The document discusses a switching regulator circuit for driving display drivers, aiming to operate at high speeds with low electromagnetic interference (EMI) output.
• It compares charge pump and switching regulator circuits, noting that charge pumps have high energy efficiency but low current capability, while switching regulators provide high current but generate EMI.
• The invention presents methods and apparatus for generating supply voltages for display driver circuits with high efficiency and low EMI, using modified switching regulator circuits.
• The modified circuits create multiple circuit paths carrying current in opposite directions to cancel out radiated noise, and include additional terminal lines to absorb any remaining EMI.
• An embodiment shows a switching regulator with interleaved source and drain paths to cancel EMI, and additional terminal paths to absorb leaking EMI fields.
• The invention enables driving large displays, such as those on Apple iPhone and iPod Touch, with sufficient current without incurring typical EMI penalties.
• Media player apparatus operating in accordance with the methods and circuits of the present invention are also provided.

• LDA covers lobbying contacts with federal officials on any subject matter, including nonlegislative matters.
• IRC section 4911 covers lobbying contacts with federal officials only on legislative matters.
• IRC section 162(e) covers lobbying contacts with federal officials on legislative and nonlegislative matters, but its coverage of nonlegislative matters is not clearly defined.

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices for producing electrical power, pressurized water, or other useful work from surface waves on a water body.
* The devices use one or more submerged gas-filled containers that expand and contract in response to overhead wave-induced pressure differences.
* The containers are partially evacuated or vented to reduce gas compression resistance and increase stroke length.
* The containers are connected to a hydraulic or pneumatic pumping means, mechanical drive means, or electrical drive means.
* The devices may include a fixed depth rigid end or surface held at a relatively fixed depth, and a movable rigid end or surface opposing the fixed end.
* The devices may include a flexible, gas-tight, reinforced, elastomer or flexible metal bellows, diaphragm, or accordion-pleated skirt connecting the fixed and movable ends.
* The devices may include a force multiplier or leveraged connecting means to increase stroke and maintain higher capture efficiency.
* The devices may include multiple drive cylinders of different sectional areas or multi-stage telescoping cylinders to produce high hydraulic pressure in moderate sea states.
* The devices may include accumulator tanks, flow check valves, or mechanical drives, ratchets, and flywells to convert the linear oscillating motion of the container expansion and contraction into smooth one-way turbine, pump, motor, or generator rotation.
* The devices may include a floating surface vent buoy or a floating wave energy converter mechanically connected to the submerged container to increase stroke, energy capture, and efficiency.
</summary>

• Current surface transportation programs are ineffective and unsustainable, with expenditures exceeding revenues and a lack of clear federal goals and roles.
• To address these challenges, a fundamental reexamination of the federal approach is needed, focusing on well-defined goals, clear federal roles, performance-based funding, best tools and approaches, and fiscal sustainability.

* <summary>
* The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) has made significant improvements in aviation security since September 11, 2001, but it is still not clear how much more secure the nation's aviation system is.
* TSA has implemented several measures to enhance aviation security, including deploying federal screeners, improving airport perimeter security, and developing a registered traveler program.
* However, TSA faces several long-term challenges, including funding and coordination issues, strategic human capital management, and building a results-oriented organization.
* The Congress has passed several aviation reauthorization bills that address various aspects of aviation security, including the deployment of explosives detection systems, the arming of cargo pilots, and the establishment of a grant program for airport security improvements.
* </summary>

<summary>
* DOD has identified 5,842 servicemembers and an estimated 350 civilians potentially exposed during Project 112 tests.
* DOD has not conducted a cost-benefit analysis to support its decision to cease actively searching for additional Project 112 exposures.
* DOD's current effort to identify exposures outside of Project 112 lacks clear objectives, scope, and oversight.
* DOD and VA have not effectively notified all potentially exposed individuals, including civilians.
</summary>

• GAO has been assessing strategic sourcing in federal acquisitions for over a decade.
• Strategic sourcing can lead to substantial savings and improved performance.
• OMB issued a memorandum in 2005 implementing strategic sourcing practices.
• FSSI was established in 2005 to address government-wide opportunities for strategic sourcing.
• In 2012, most agencies leveraged only a fraction of their buying power through strategic sourcing.
• Agencies face challenges in obtaining reliable data, securing expertise, and gaining leadership support for strategic sourcing.
• Disincentives for strategic sourcing include fear of budget cuts and difficulty finding existing contracts.
• Services procurement is particularly relevant given current fiscal constraints but is often inefficient.
• Federal agencies are reluctant to apply strategic sourcing to services due to standardization difficulties.
• Leading companies have achieved savings of 4 to 15 percent through strategically sourcing services.

* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for tools used in material treatment, such as machining, which can be applied in various technologies like milling, drilling, turning, etc., and is particularly advantageous for use in cutting, punching, molding, and forming work, especially in machining of metal sheets.
* The fixing mechanism comprises a tool, its frame, and a tool holder in the frame of a machine tool, where at least one of the connecting surfaces between the tool frame and the tool holder is shaped as a curved surface, and the first contact surface in connection with the tool frame and the second contact surface in the tool holder are adjusted to be placed against each other in the operational position of the fixing mechanism to transmit machining force between the tool frame and the tool holder.
* The curved connecting surface can be either in the tool frame or the tool holder, and it is designed in a manner that the distance between the radius of curvature of the curved surface and the center located on the center line of the tool holder in the mounting direction and the contact surface fulfills the formula: r^2 = D^2 + d^2, where r is the radius of curvature, D is the radius of the contact surface perpendicular to the mounting direction, and d is the distance between the center of the radius of curvature and the contact surface in the mounting direction.
* The fixing mechanism allows for a simple and secure fixing of the tool and its frame in the tool holder by a movement defined by the curved surface, and the contact surfaces transmit the machining force in the mounting direction or by means of a frictional contact in a direction substantially perpendicular to the mounting direction.

• The SEC's financial statements were fairly stated in all material respects for fiscal years 2007 and 2006, but the agency had one material weakness and three significant control deficiencies in internal control.
• The material weakness was in the financial reporting process, including period-end financial reporting, disgorgements and penalties accounts receivable, accounting for transaction fee revenue, and preparing financial statement disclosures.

• NCHIP is a federal grant program managed by BJS to build a national infrastructure for criminal history records.
• States use NCHIP funds for various purposes, with the majority going towards NICS/III/criminal records improvements and disposition reporting improvements.
• The 5 case-study states (California, Maryland, Mississippi, Texas, and West Virginia) have used NCHIP funds primarily for NICS/III/criminal records improvements and disposition reporting improvements.
• The 5 priority states (Maine, Mississippi, New Mexico, Vermont, and West Virginia) have made progress in automating their criminal history records using NCHIP funds.
• No NCHIP funds have been used to develop or implement a ballistics registration system.

<summary>
* The government of Mexico has been struggling to combat the growing power of criminal groups that initially emerged as DTOs in the 1980s and 1990s.
* In 2006, then-President Felipe Calderón mobilized the Mexican military and law enforcement agencies to disrupt DTO operations and target their leadership structures.
* Mexican DTOs' criminal activity now extends to other areas, including human trafficking, kidnapping, money laundering, extortion, bribery, racketeering, and weapons trafficking.
* Firearms that criminal organizations acquire from the United States are primarily transported overland using the same routes and methods employed when smuggling bulk cash south and drugs north across the U.S.-Mexico border.
* ATF and ICE are the two primary agencies combating illicit sales and trafficking of firearms across the Southwest border.
* The government of Mexico collects data on the number of firearms its law enforcement entities seize each year, but our analysis and findings refer exclusively to the universe of firearms seized in Mexico that were submitted for tracing using eTrace.
</summary>

• The Postal Service had about 765,000 career employees at the end of fiscal year 1997, with 96% working at the cluster level.
• The Service's diversity program aims to create an all-inclusive business environment and achieve a diverse workforce as diverse as the CLF.
• The Service commissioned Aguirre International to study its diversity program, which found that women and minorities appeared to face barriers to advancement to EAS 17 and above positions.
• The Service developed an action plan to address diversity issues raised by Aguirre, including 23 initiatives aimed at strengthening its diversity program.
• The Service collects diversity-related data but lacks reliable data on the flow of applicants through its promotion processes, which could help identify barriers to the promotion of women and minorities.

<summary>
* The Food Stamp Program provides eligible low-income households with benefits to purchase food, with funding and regulations set by the Food and Nutrition Service (FNS).
* FNS offers various options and waivers to states to increase program access, reduce reporting burden, and minimize payment errors, such as extending benefits to households leaving Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF), allowing states to exclude vehicles from asset calculations, and providing transitional benefits.
* FNS monitors states' performance through a quality control system, assessing their accuracy in determining eligibility and calculating benefits, with penalties for higher-than-average payment error rates.
</summary>

<summary>
• The Department of Defense (DOD) defines Military Working Dogs (MWD) as canines bred, procured, or acquired to support operations in protecting installations, resources, and personnel.
• MWDs are removed from service due to medical or behavior problems, when they're no longer needed, or in other circumstances like a handler's death in action.
• "Robby's Law" promotes the adoption of MWDs after their military service, giving priority to former handlers, then others capable of humane care, and finally law enforcement agencies.
• DOD is not liable for veterinary expenses associated with adopted MWDs for conditions present before transfer.
• MWD disposition involves a review board that includes a Commander, veterinarians, and may consult with Kennel Masters and veterinary staff.
• Adopted MWDs may receive preventative care and medical assistance through nonprofit organizations and DOD medical services, depending on access and availability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The Comanche helicopter program was established in 1983 to replace the Army's light helicopter fleet.
* The program aims to develop a low-cost, lightweight, advanced technology helicopter for armed reconnaissance and attack missions.
* The Army must meet ambitious maintainability goals to achieve lower operating and support costs and wartime operational availability.
* In 1994, the Secretary of Defense restructured the program due to budget constraints, extending the development phase and reducing funding.
* The Army proposed and DOD approved a plan to acquire six "early operational capability" aircraft in addition to two prototypes.
* Operational testing will not begin until after funds are committed to buy production aircraft, raising concerns about concurrency risks.
* The program has experienced significant increases in acquisition unit cost since 1985, with the current estimate at $34.4 million per aircraft.
</summary>

<summary>
* HUD is the principal federal agency responsible for programs in housing assistance, community development, housing finance, and regulatory issues related to areas such as lead-based paint abatement and fair housing.
* HUD's fiscal year 2000 budget request includes 19 new initiatives and programs, with seven set-asides totaling $210 million, including $60 million in the CDBG Program and $150 million in the HOME Program.
* The budget request represents a 9-percent increase in budget authority over fiscal year 1999, with significant funding increases in several ongoing programs, including Section 8 contract renewals.
* GAO is concerned about HUD's capacity to manage the increase while undergoing organizational reform and has raised questions about the accuracy of HUD's budget proposals for the Section 8 housing assistance program.
</summary>

<summary>
* The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA), also known as Superfund, was enacted in 1980 to clean up hazardous waste sites.
* EPA investigates contaminated areas and places the most severely contaminated sites on the National Priorities List (NPL) for study and cleanup.
* Incineration is one of the remedies used to clean up Superfund sites, with EPA having selected it 43 times as of 1995.
* Incinerators used at Superfund sites are generally transportable and exempt from obtaining permits, but they must meet RCRA's substantive requirements.
* EPA uses four principal methods to ensure the safe operation of incinerators: setting site-specific standards, incorporating safety features, monitoring emissions, and providing 24-hour on-site oversight.
* EPA has not fully implemented two additional methods to promote the safe operation of Superfund incinerators: periodic evaluations by hazardous waste incinerator inspectors and systematic sharing of lessons learned.
* EPA's guidance for having RCRA hazardous waste incinerator inspectors evaluate Superfund incinerators was not followed at two of the three incinerators operating at the time of the review.
* A single document specifying site-specific operating requirements and procedures for Superfund incinerators was not developed, which hindered inspections.
* EPA agreed with the report's findings and recommendations but questioned the benefits of preparing voluminous site-specific studies on lessons learned given the decreasing use of incineration.
</summary>

• ICE officers and attorneys exercise discretion throughout the alien apprehension and removal process.
• Discretion is exercised in six phases: initial encounter, apprehension, charging, detention, removal proceedings, and final removal.
• Officers have the most discretion during the initial phases of the apprehension and removal process.
• ICE has established policies, guidance, and training to guide officer decision making.
• ICE has supervisory review practices and an inspection program to monitor officer decision making.
• ICE does not have a mechanism to analyze information specific to the exercise of discretion.
• ICE does not consistently disseminate information on legal developments to officers.
• ICE does not collect and analyze data on officers’ exercise of discretion in determining removal processing options.

• Before 1996, Medicare program integrity activities were subsumed under its general administrative budget and performed by insurance companies under contract with CMS.
• HIPAA established the Medicare Integrity Program (MIP) in 1997, providing CMS with dedicated funding for program integrity activities.
• MIP funds are allocated to five activities: audit, medical review, secondary payer, benefit integrity, and provider education.
• CMS plans to use additional MIP funds provided by DRA for fiscal year 2006 to support program integrity efforts for the new Part D prescription drug benefit.

• The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) engages in three primary activities: aviation safety oversight, ATC, and airport infrastructure development.
• FAA's costs associated with each of these activities generally depend on the nature and usage of the specific service FAA provides.
• FAA safety activities include the licensing of pilots and mechanics, as well as the inspection of various aspects of the aviation system, such as aircraft and airline operations.
• ATC includes a variety of complex activities that guide and control the flow of aircraft through the NAS.
• FAA funds airport infrastructure development through the Airport Improvement Program (AIP).
• The Airport and Airway Revenue Act of 1970 established the Trust Fund to help fund the development of a nationwide airport and airway system.
• The Trust Fund provides funding for FAA’s two capital accounts, AIP and the Facilities and Equipment account, which funds technological improvements to the ATC system.
• The Trust Fund also supports part of FAA’s operations.
• The ticket tax is the largest single source of Trust Fund revenue in fiscal year 2005, totaling about $5.2 billion, or about 48 percent of all Trust Fund receipts.
• The passenger ticket tax was followed by the passenger segment tax and the international departure/arrival taxes, which each totaled about $1.9 billion.
• The fuel taxes totaled $870 million, the cargo/mail tax totaled $461 million, and interest income totaled $430 million.
• The Trust Fund's uncommitted balance was about $1.9 billion at the end of fiscal year 2005.
• The National Civil Aviation Review Commission (Commission) issued a Congressional report in 1997 analyzing several issues, including alternative funding means to meet the needs of the nation’s aviation system.
• The Commission made several unanimous recommendations, including that FAA’s revenues be more closely linked to the costs of services provided to support ATC activities, including capital investments.
• The Commission also recommended that General Fund revenues be used to fund aviation security and safety activities and government use of the air traffic system, and that GA operators continue to pay a fuel tax, although perhaps at a higher rate.
• Some stakeholders support the current excise tax system, stating that it has been successful in funding FAA, has low administrative costs, and distributes the tax burden in a reasonable manner.
• Other stakeholders, including FAA, state that under the current system,

• Ground ambulance services vary by organizational structure, staffing types, transport types, and revenue sources.
• Medicare payments for ambulance services consist of a service-level payment and a mileage payment.
• Providers can be affiliated with institutions, independent, for-profit, nonprofit, or government-based, and may rely on volunteers, paid staff, or both.
• Providers may specialize in nonemergency transports or offer both nonemergency and emergency transports, and may provide basic life support (BLS) or advanced life support (ALS) services.
• Revenue sources for ambulance services can include community tax support, charitable donations, state and federal grants, subscription programs, and payments from Medicare, Medicaid, and private health insurance companies.
• Medicare pays ambulance providers through a national fee schedule, with payments adjusted for geographic practice cost index (GPCI) and add-on payments for rural and super-rural areas.
